text.p: - A technical hitch on board the U.S. space shuttle Columbia could amend NASA's programme of international flights.
- The United States is about to perform its first nuclear test since it joined a global test ban a year ago. The controlled explosion presumably will not spur a chain reaction and violate the ban.
- Dmitry Ryurikov, Boris Yeltsin's foreign policy adviser, loses his post amid rumours his boss was unhappy with the way he handled work on the Russia-Belarus union treaty.
- Over one million bootleg compact discs produced in Bulgaria are imported into Russia every month.
- The new team in the government plans to take on the nomenklatura capitalism which took firm root in Russia.
- The latest cabinet reshuffle has created a virtual one-party government for the first time in years.
- Tensions over the union treaty between Russia and Belarus are easing slowly.
- Any attempt to stall the unification of Russia and Belarus will damage the countries' international image.

- Moscow circus keepers had to offer a bucket of vodka to three elephants to prevent them from catching cold after a day travelling in freezing temperatures. Eye-witnesses say elephants react to alcohol differently -- some fall asleep, some start stumbling around and flirting with people.
